website_summaries.verdict: A handy set with four grit levels and a base that makes sharpening knives easy, but the stones may not be hard enough for all blade-sharpening tasks.
pros: Versatile waterstones that don't require oil
Can sharpen or create a precision edge on most knives with the multiple grits that consist of 400/1,000 and 3,000/8,000
cons: Somewhat soft, resulting in erosion of stones with repeated use and/or when used to sharpen extremely dull or damaged blades

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I every made
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I every made. while my knife doesnt cut a fine layer of tomato without touching it, it became as good as it was when I purchased. I recommend users to learn how to properly sharpen the knife. It took me about 30 minutes to sharpen a single knife to what it is today. The knife gets really sharp. Also, with use, the surface gets uneven. I recommend you draw a grid in pencil and then file using the grinder stone until the grids disappear. This ensures the surface remains flat during all use.
customer_reviews.author: Enigma

customer_reviews.title: Great, but missing flattening stone!
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but my kit is missing the flattening accessory stone. That's a real disappointment when I come back into Amazon to rate my product, selecting it from my orders list, and see that it now comes with a flattening stone. The bamboo base, rubber feet, and stones are good quality. I bought plastic tubs to house the working stone and soak the non-working stone, turning the latter into the overall storage case when not sharpening. How about sending me the flattening stone for the 5th star?
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Set for Knife Sharpening
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a quality set of water sharpening stones. For a set of 4 stones, I tend to doubt that one can find a better price. They also have a LOT of instructional videos and PDFs to guide you. This set for sure works to cleanup your knives. Learning how to properly sharpening knives takes time. These stones WILL do the job. The proper form is performing over and over and muscle memory. Start with a "crappy" knife, take your time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L. Dubrul

customer_reviews.title: Junk stones. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible stones. Makes a huge mess every time I try to sharpen with them. They are way too soft and I spend more time re-flattening them than actually sharpening on them. You get what you pay for. I don't know where people are finding value in such soft useless stones. I have woodworking chisels I have been trying to polish and sharpen for hours and these stones literally just don't cut it. The surfaces sharper, sure, but the mess they make and the constant re-flattening of the stones required is a complete waste of time and money. Spend $200 and get diamond stones in coarse, medium, and super fine. These are a waste of your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: DON’T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Horrible - DO NOT ORDER! ABSOLUTE GARBAGE - will buy an oil stone - these are simply clay blocks!! You are better off dragging your blades through the dirt. I’ve been sharpening knives for 45 years and this is a total waste of money. If someone pays you to take theirs pocket the money and trash the stones! 1 star rating is Too High!!
customer_reviews.author: Smooth Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I am just starting out sharpening with whet stones. I have found these stones to be very nice and the instructional videos that come along with the set on knifeplanet are extremely helpful to anyone starting out. The cost of the set was very reasonable and seems to be a great value. The customer service is amazing, I lost the site for the videos and sent an email to get the information and immediately there was a reply with all of the links that I needed. I appreciate their attention to their customers!!
customer_reviews.author: Jael

customer_reviews.title: You should spend more for better quality than these
customer_reviews.text: These stones look and act like quality Japanese water stones, but they are all very coarse and wear away quickly. The nagura stone is great, and the rubber holder and bamboo stand are pretty good. The stones do as they had ought - they create a slurry and grind away at the blade. However, they are all very coarse. None are fine enough for a final polish. I used them to re-home some kitchen knives but after using the 4 grits, I found that 2000 grit sandpaper and a strop were needed to finish the edges. Honestly I wish I hadn't purchased these stones.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan B. MarshTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control, but a decent value for all you get.
customer_reviews.text: Stones are nice with a few caveats: 1. The 400/1000 grit is too long (by about 1/16") to for in the bamboo holder with the rubber foot provided. It basically means the stone sits at an angle always and the water doesn't stay on one end. Minor annoyance, but still. 2. The higher grit stone seems to work backwards. The 4000 grit (red) is much softer than the 8000 (white) side and seems to do better for a finish polish. I wonder if I got a bad stone or if it's mislabeled. I do like the bamboo holder and the dressing stone included so it's not a bad value.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing or quality control issues present.
customer_reviews.text: Received the stone set this morning and aside from the flattening stone, used each stone once to sharpen a single kitchen knife. Followed included directions, soaked stones for 10 minutes before use and applied water during use. After a single use the 3000 grit stone was falling apart on the sides/edges just from the pressure of my fingers holding the stone in my hand and some kind of surface discontinuity (like ovoid drops of glue inside the stone maybe) could be felt on the surface. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not flat at all
customer_reviews.text: You couldn't get these stones flat if you wanted to. The "flattening stone" was not flat at all either. I took the time to try to flatten it and I wasn't able to make any progress. Not recommended at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Cline

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, value & performance. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I searched & searched for the right set to start sharpening on. Now I'm about 50 knives in and I'm really happy with this set. There is no question whatsoever, the sharpness of your knives using these stones is going to come down to your level of skill. (Which will only improve with practice.) They do exactly what they should. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky G.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: These stones are of a uniform quality and of fantastic value as a set especially considering the flattener included but don't work well on stainless steel or special ultra tough knife alloys. For repairing chipped and dented thin carbon steel knives and razors that can be stropped to a wicked level of sharpness once they have a smooth unbroken edge you can't get a better deal. Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wiggin

customer_reviews.title: nice all around
customer_reviews.text: Great value, can bring even the worst blade damage back into razor sharp edge. I was able to put a decent edge on a Ak bayonet. My quality knives are razor blade sharp. The low grade steel kitchen knives are quick to sharpen with this stone. The 4 grits really make life easy for damaged steel. Much better than any of the v block and electric sharpeners. If you have a variety of knives to sharpen this is ideal. its slow and somewhat relaxing but taking a hunk of abused metal from soviet bloc and turning it into a box cutter sharp blade can only be done with stones of this type.
customer_reviews.author: Shane S.

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: If you don't mind spending for other trying to sharpen one night not knowing if the angle is even correct Mondays are for you I tried it I was not impressed. Very difficult to figure out if you're getting the angle quickly or not the guy that comes with it is about useless I tried it on a very dull knife and it did make it sharper but not worth the time it took to do it. Not to mention the mess
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy. Good quality. Maybe better for an intermediate skillset
customer_reviews.text: I think this stone set is great. I was able to put a new edge on my favorite Wushtof and it’s wizzing through meat, bone veg now. If you have limited experience with knife sharpening you may watch a few videos online first, I don’t believe the instructions provided are informative enough and you may damage your cutlery. Base holder looks good also which is a plus
customer_reviews.author: ash.s

customer_reviews.title: Really nice stones
customer_reviews.text: It comes beautifully packaged. My corners were chipped though... I don’t know how. They come in soft foam. But it’s not like a chipped corner will affect my sharpening. I still like these a lot. They will work great for anyone looking for a tiered sharpening set. Unless you’re trying to sharpen swords or something. You might want to look into grinders lol
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Real nice set
customer_reviews.text: I got my new set the other day and put it to good use today. Put razor sharp edges on my son’s Ka-Bar and my bali-song. These stones did a wonderful job and will probably last longer than me. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SKS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Whetstones!  Customer for life!
customer_reviews.text: KnifePlanet really put together a great kit right down to the packaging! It is the perfect kit for the beginner or expert. Great quality, the stones are dead on the grit level and flat. No little bumps or impurities come up during sharpening as I have seen with others. The 8000 grit is actually better quality than my 10,000 and brings a better surface. 3 stones double sided going from 400, to 1000, then 3000 to 8000 + a resurfacing stone. Plus 2 silicone stone pads and a bamboo block with anti slip pad underneath. I was also sent a comprehensive PDF on knife sharpening with a whetstone. Looking forward to the 10,000 and 12,000 kit!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Knife Planet Stones review.
customer_reviews.text: The things I like best: instructional material, videos, and support. Also.. the packaging is really nice. I will use the packaging for storage. I was thinking I would need to get a storage bin, but the original packaging is stout. I'm still developing my skills. I wouldn't say I'm good at this yet, but this bundle is a great start to learning how to keep all my knives sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hein

customer_reviews.title: perfect for sharpening and tuning up your home knives
customer_reviews.text: works great. note that my knives were not rusted and just needed a tune up, but cuts through anything like new. the bamboo base does slip after you start dipping your stones in water during the sharpening process. i just used some paper towels to line the bottom (surprisingly, it worked), and also around the counter so that the water doesn't drip on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: NH Li

customer_reviews.title: not your fathers oil stones
customer_reviews.text: These were my first water stones, so it took some getting use keeping the surface clean and flat. Unlike oil stones you don't want a slurry. Also they wear much quicker hence the included flattening stone. However the quality of the edge is much better than I expected. Great Product, and great info included from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Riggins

customer_reviews.title: Great stone sharpening set. Super happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I used them as soon as I received this to sharpen all our kitchen and filet knives. Worked great to restore the edge quickly and I used a honing steel to finish and now all our knives are lethal again. Very nice stone set. Plus the box they come in works great to store them back in.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sonnek

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money, but not great
customer_reviews.text: For the price of this set it's an amazing value for the money. Recommended if you have some knives and aren't a huge freak They are rather soft and work over very easy. They need wetting often. The bamboo stand and flattening stone are excellently well made and the highest quality part for the price To put it into perspective, the stones are "good enough" I sharpened a 6 inch blade, two 5 inch blades, an a 3 inch blade. I put a new angle on them all with a seperate stone and finished with these and they are sharp enough to cut tank tread. Recommended if you're on a limited dime like me.
customer_reviews.author: Macul Synthelik

customer_reviews.title: Stones are fine but not graded accurately, example, 8K grit stone not even close to 8k
customer_reviews.text: Stones are fine but not graded accurately, example, 8K grit stone not even close to 8k
customer_reviews.author: steve a

customer_reviews.title: Blade guie does not work on slim narrow blades.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to sharpen steak knife set because of the blade guide. However, our steak knives are slim (almost like filet knives) and were not acceptable in the blade guide. An otherwise nice set of stones. It just wasn't what I needed for anyone in the house to be able to use.
customer_reviews.author: P. Moran

customer_reviews.title: The Sharpest!
customer_reviews.text: Watch the excellent "How to sharpen your knife" videosfrom Knife Planet before you begin. Don't worry -practice makes perfect! I just love the stones! I soak them completely for about 5 minutes for best performance from the stones. Start with the coarse stones to prepare the edges, as you go from coarse to fine. Keep the stones safe, you do NOT want to chip them. Practice, practice, Practice!
customer_reviews.author: Beldar Conehead

customer_reviews.title: Almost a home run...
customer_reviews.text: The stones are great and the included leveling stone works great. The wood and plastic holders for the stones are not great. Looks like i will be making my own holder that keep the stone from moving during sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality stones from a great company
customer_reviews.text: The package came with all the stones (including the flattening block) nicely packaged and very secure in a nice box. I'm new to sharpening, but I really like using these water stones. I got the reference from Peter Nowlan's online knife sharpening course (free, it's on Youtube), and I was so impressed with his mastery that I decided to purchase the stones from Knife Planet. Overall, I really like how Knife Planet does business, and it seems like they really, truly care about the recipient of their products and provide so many resources to learn from. I just love the feel of the company and will continue to shop there.
customer_reviews.author: Knottwood

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: I use the stones to sharpen my chefs knife and my yanagiba. I get really good results.. they actually feel good quality for the price. And it comes with a flattening stone. The only part that I dislike is that they are not very wide they’re a little bit too narrow for me. But that’s just nitpicking.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Galvan

customer_reviews.title: Mislabeled Grits
customer_reviews.text: It took me a few times using these to figure out that the Grit numbers seem to be backwards. 400 should be the roughest grit with 8000 being the smoothest. It takes forever to flatten or bevel with the 400 but it leaves a mirror finish, and the 8000 will flatten easily but leaves a rough finish. Basically the same with the 1000 and 4000, all labelled in reverse order. Once figuring that out they seem to be all right, nothing special, but the first few uses were driving me crazy trying to determine what i was doing wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Kenworthy

customer_reviews.title: Great sharping stone kit.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent multi tier sharpening stones. In minutes had a knife fully restored with an incredible edge and in an hour after a little practice could get the entire set done. Easy to use. Only drawback I encountered was that the non slip base of the block actually began to slip a little when the Formica counter top got a little water on, so put down a good cloth first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy I invested in these stones. As a professional meat cutter/ fish monger I need my knives very sharp. I put a 10 degree angle on my knives and they are like razors. Not sure what some of the others who commented are doing, saying they wore them down after a few uses. Mine are holding up extremely well. Would buy again ESPECIALLY for the leveling stone. The only slightly annoying issue I have with the set is having to soak them for a min of 10 minutes before use.
customer_reviews.author: John P Barcelo

customer_reviews.title: Value Purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The set is nicely built overall. I believe that the grit may actually be slightly higher than advertised. If you need to rough in an edge that is chipped, or have a rounded bevel I would recommend purchasing a low grit and inexpensive stone to supplement as the first step. These feel like soft stones but, they seem to be wearing at a reasonable rate. Use the stone that they supply to keep the stones true, I use it religiously. I was able to get several good grade and well worn fillet knives sharp enough to slice tomatoes paper thin and translucent.
customer_reviews.author: Vincenzo

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need to sharpen a knife in one complete package. Beginner or master, this kit will get it done! Their website has some videos and tips for beginners as well. I would definitely buy from knifeplanet again. Thanks for a great kit.
customer_reviews.author: bbrider

customer_reviews.title: Cool tool!
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp gift!! I wanted to wrap each stone separately so it seemed like a super better gift. If you do this it takes a long time so drink wine while wrapping. My son loved the gift but thought the gift wrapping was a bit obsessive.
customer_reviews.author: Ms M&M

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have a lot to compare this to. What it has is what I wanted a coarse to an ultra fine. Four different grits if you will. I’ve had it a few weeks and sharpened some knives up real nice. This is my first set of Japanese stones so I am satisfied. They are not natural but synthetic, hence the good price.
customer_reviews.author: rockabillybanger

customer_reviews.title: A true professional's set, yet perfect for a beginner...
customer_reviews.text: This is a COMPLETE sharpener set. With four different grits and a stone to true the others and a safety shim to help a newbie get the angle right. Comes in a great package for longterm storage. Also comes with a comprehensive set of instructions. You can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Razor sharp
customer_reviews.text: I use these to bring my kitchen knives to silly angles. With this and some jewlers rouge you can probably slice cleanly through a fly's wings if you were fast and accurate enough.
customer_reviews.author: Khang Truong

customer_reviews.title: Saved me from buying new knives
customer_reviews.text: Stones worked better than expected. I’ve never used stones before so I practiced on a really old knife that I hadn’t used in years. It was amazing how well it worked. It was razor sharp in about 10 minutes. The rest of my knives are sharper than when they were brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: simple and effective Knife Sharpener
customer_reviews.text: The wet stones are packaged well in closed cell foam and a sturdy box. Each block was clean, flat, and clearly marked. The Bamboo base is varnished for easy cleaning and has a non-slip base, making it easy to use on my granite counter tops. If you want extremely sharp and polished cutlery then this set will get you 90% there. Only thing not included with my set was a leather strop for straightening the edge bur. I bought that separately to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Kealbtl

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for the price.
customer_reviews.text: What a great value for the sharpening stones. Unpacked and watched the video. I soaked the stones for 30 minutes and started at 1000. The hardest part is the angle, but that just takes practice. After about 10-15 strokes per side, moved to 5000 for polishing. My knives are sharp again! Even able to slice newspaper easily. I do recommend putting the base on some rubber shelf liner if you have it as the water and formica causes the base to slip. Get it and take your time. You'll be happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The whole package.
customer_reviews.text: This set works great at home and at the restaurant. It has four different grits for whatever you need. I personally don't use the bamboo holder it comes with I would rather just use a wet towel but maybe that's just because I'm a bit messy (wet) when sharpening my knives. There are better stones that cost more but this is a good set for any kind of knife. If you have a $500 yanagi knife then you should use more expensive stones. Nonetheless these get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Thao

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home use.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical after reading the other reviews. These stones are not the most expensive but perfectly fine for a hobby user. I would recommend them for sharpening chisels and knives. Great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: palabras

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sharpening kit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit to sharpen knives and woodworking tools. It's a perfect collection of all the stones needed. I've tried several types of stones before both oil and water stones and these worked really well. I'm very happy with the kit.
customer_reviews.author: BullyRescue

customer_reviews.title: If accuracy is important, pass on this.
customer_reviews.text: The stone is okay but don't buy for the fixture as it is not well made. It does not accommodate my chisels and I couldn't get it to hold my plane knife very well. If you want a good edge on your chisels and blades using a fixture, don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lori H.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am nowhere near an expert and sharpening knives can be a challenge. But after using simpler sharpening devices (and not getting the results I wanted), I decided to try sharpening my knives using these stones. I will definitely need to improve my technique but I am totally satisfied with the results I got. I don't recall my knives being to sharp! Cooking prep has gotten much simpler and fun.
customer_reviews.author: JYoo

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for myself. Exactly as advertised and the videos are great! I took it to my family's Christmas and sharpened all of the knives in my mom's and sister's houses. Was great to practice on other folk's knives. Works especially well for large knives. I am a pocket knife person and did use them for my old Case knives and they worked well. They were also great at quickly answering email questions. Great product!! I am sure it will serve me for many years. So much better than the cheap stones sold at other large knife stores. Buy it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: chris u.

customer_reviews.title: Great kit to start out with
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved how affordable this kit is. It's the first time I've ever used a sharpening stone and it was actually quite easy to get the hang of with very little prep work required. I'm a beginner and by the end of the first day my parents entire knife set was sharper than it had ever been, even out of the factory. So in short this kit is affordable, easy to use, and extremely effective if you know what you're doing. This kit will help anytime I need a sharp edge for cooking, shaving, or just for show.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Davis

customer_reviews.title: Work well, softer than other stones.
customer_reviews.text: These stones are great so far. The first thing i noticed is that i had to keep flattening them. I used them to sharpen my bench chisels and they developed a “well” in the middle after only one chisel. Which made that chisel rounded. Now I know to stop and flatten every couple of min.
customer_reviews.author: Tony A.

customer_reviews.title: A company that cares about integrity in every regard
customer_reviews.text: This company has proven to me it’s integrity and firmness for its dedication to quality and trust in their products and customer service. Although I had a slight mishap, they immediately made it right and I would recommend KNIFEPLANET to anyone looking for a company this committed to its customers and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W.

customer_reviews.title: Stones arrive chipped
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of stones I have from these folks. Both stones have been received with chips out of them, the stones are useable but I’m just using them to sharpen small knives at work. With the chips I do not think they would be good for longer knives. Is it a shipping problem or a stone problem idk.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Order was delivered ahead of time
customer_reviews.text: Product was all and more than my son expected for sharpening his knives. Wonderful set, great value for the money. My son takes his sharpening seriously, and he is immensely pleased with the product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for knives, but not a great kit for chisel/plane blades.
customer_reviews.text: This is a commodity stone with a custom logo printed on the 6000 grit surface that needs to be removed before use for plane blade sharpening. The included honing guide is not precision machined and yields a slight camber for larger widths and is not usable at all for narrow width chisels. For knife sharpening, this stone is perfectly functional.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P Ege

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginner knife sharpening
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It does exactly what I had hoped it would. As a side note for other buyers, if you’re trying to sharpen a very dull knife or one that is made of very hard steel, I’d recommend also purchasing a more abrasive stone. The 400 grit does well on knives that already have an edge on them, but for damaged or severely dull knives, it takes a while to get a burr. Not impossible, just a little more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Great even if you're a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this without having any prior experience with whetstones or water stones, and I was able to put a keen edge on my Buck 102. The base is sturdy enough and grips nicely. The only thing I would recommend is having a leather strop so you can finish off the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice stones
customer_reviews.text: I have inexpensive chisels from HD but now they are super sharp! As a weekend woodworker, this set is all I’ll ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D. Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Knife sharpening is a skill that can only be acquired through practice.
customer_reviews.text: I used these stones to sharpen an old stainless steel butter knife to see if they worked well. I was able to shave with it when I was done. That said, I used it the stone to sharpen all of my cooking and carving knives!!! Amazing. All you need is a little 3-in-1 oil, elbow grease and patience. AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Mindhunter Profiler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kit! Maybe a must to have.
customer_reviews.text: This kit it has the necessary to keep your knifes or tools sharp as razor blade.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: If you need it sharp, get these stones.
customer_reviews.text: The stones with their rubber piece didn't fit well into the bamboo base. But a tiny bit of chisel work and some varnish fixed it up. I especially liked that the harder you pushed down the better grip the base gets on the table. It makes the stones easy to work with. They seem to be a perfect size for doing large kitchen knifes and smaller pocket knives.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Heim

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My son, who does culinary, wanted some good knife sharpeners for his birthday. He asked for these. He is very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Good stone set.
customer_reviews.text: Good stones. Order arrived lightening fast. Check out KnifePlanet on youtube to learn how to use them.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: First impression
customer_reviews.text: The blocks seem to be great quality. The instructions are clear and easy to understand. The knife guide seems more like just a better grip on the knife itself, than a guide. I'd recommend free handing the sharpening to develop better sharpening habits. I want to try with my clippers for my dog. I'll update later.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary soberalski

customer_reviews.title: Works great when used corrctly
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to flatten your stones first before using. Soak them for 10 min and it'll sharpen your knives wonderfully.Very happy with product. First time ever using wet stones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Set
customer_reviews.text: I was very please with how fast these stones arrived at my house. Having the ability to go from course to fine is incredibly nice. The stones work great and have put a nice edge and polish on a few of my knives. This is very easy to use and set up and the rubber base pads help keep the stones from sliding around. Everything fit well in the box too for storage. I could not be happier with my purchase and will be pleased to use these moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Full Set is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great stones, only upset is the base. Rubber is more slippery than the rubber around the actual stones. Slips less if I use the stone grips instead of the base.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic water stones.
customer_reviews.text: These stones are great, they are thicker, wider and longer they any I have, I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you follow directions and this can make a super sharp knife.
customer_reviews.author: Enzo

customer_reviews.title: Sharpening Stones
customer_reviews.text: Stones do great job of putting a sharp edge on kitchen knifes. The 400 removes nicks from knifes quickly. Most of the knifes sharpened using only the using the 1000,3000 and 8000 grit. Knifes were sharp enough to cut 20 lb copy paper buy just running knife at 45 on edge with very little effort. My wife loved it when cutting vegetables with no effort.
